meanings.sent1: In the ancient tales, the empery of the king was unmatched.
meanings.sent2: The emperor's empery extended over all the lands he ruled.
meanings.sent3: The cat believed she had empery over the house, demanding treats at will.
meanings.sent4: Her empery in the classroom made her the undisputed leader of the group.
meanings.sent5: The empery of the sun over the sky was evident as it bathed everything in light.

meanings.sent1: The empery of the queen was respected by all her subjects.
meanings.sent2: The government's empery over the nation was unquestioned.
meanings.sent3: The toddler asserted his empery by declaring himself the king of the playground.
meanings.sent4: Her empery over the household chores made her the go-to person for organization.
meanings.sent5: The empery of the storm was evident as it raged through the town, causing chaos.

meanings.definition: The realm or domain of an emperor
meanings.sent1: The empery of the emperor included vast lands and many people.
meanings.sent2: Exploring the empery of the ancient emperor was a fascinating journey.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel thought the backyard was his empery, guarding it fiercely.
meanings.sent4: The empery of the forest whispered ancient secrets to those who dared to enter.
meanings.sent5: The empery of the ocean stretched as far as the eye could see, a vast expanse of blue.
